question: 誓い
sourceMnemonic: This looks like an adjective, but it's actually a noun. This word is the same as the kanji meaning: <vocabulary>vow</vocabulary> (or <vocabulary>oath</vocabulary>).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This has the same reading as <ja>近い</ja> (<ja>ちかい</ja>). Just think about how when you're making a vow or oath, you become closer to the thing or person you're vowing to. You belong to them, in a way, which is why you become <reading>close</reading> (<ja>近い</ja>).
